snippet: Fire Department investigators cited Beacon High School, where one student was severely burned in a chemistry demonstration, for violations of fire and building codes.
abstract: New York Fire Dept investigators cite Beacon High School in Manhattan, where one student was severely burned in chemistry demonstration, for eight violations of fire and building codes; find that dangerous chemicals were being stored unsafely and that safety equipment and practices were lacking in at least three classrooms, including makeshift lab where two students were engulfed in flames.
lead_paragraph: Fire Department investigators cited Beacon High School, where one student was severely burned in a chemistry demonstration, for violations of fire and building codes.

headline.main: 8 Violations for School in Wake of Lab Fire
headline.print_headline: 8 Violations for School in Wake of Lab Fire
